name: Starting Out
description: A rudimentary course for beginners to being their Spanish learning journey

lessons.description: Greetings and opening phrases, Introducing yourself and Others, Days of the Week and Seasons, Family Members

content.story: Title: Family Morning Routine - Una mañana, la familia Méndez se estaba preparando para ir a la escuela. Mía, la hija, tenía que cepillarse los dientes, cepillarse el pelo, desayunar y vestirse. Translation: One morning, the Mendez family was getting ready for school. Mia, the daughter, had to brush her teeth, brush her hair, eat breakfast, and put on clothes.

Title: Market Adventure - La familia Méndez fue al mercado el domingo para comprar frutas y verduras frescas. Translation: The Mendez family went to the market on Sunday to buy fresh fruits and vegetables.

questions.content: How do you say 'Goodbye' in Spanish?
Match the word 'Hello' to its Spanish equivalent.
Is 'Gracias' the correct word for 'Thank you'?
What is the Spanish word for 'Please'?
